description.title: What is Modeling?
description.content:
Most phenomena involved in physical systems are governed by well-defined scientific laws.
These laws correlate different properties and provide insights to the states of a system and 
processes it undergoes. Mathematical models can therefore be derived based 
on the laws, allowing scientists and engineers to explain what has happened and 
predict what will happen.If a mathematical model is too complicated to be solved, a computer will be needed. 
Thus, we have a computational model that approximates the solution using some
algorithms. Computational models are now increasingly important parts of 
computer-aided design (CAD) packages, which are in the tool box of almost every engineer 
whose job involves research and development (R&D). Computational models are often called
simulations. So we will use the two terms interchangably.
Today's students need to have a fundamental understanding of what computational models
are and how they can be used to accelerate R&D processes.The following is a simple model of solar heating of a house. Use the controls to play with it and explore how such a model contributes to 
developing an understanding of the physical variables and processes involved in designing solar houses.
